intro: Ptiloria myrioclada, commonly known as the many-branched ptiloria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are often clustered in dense, spherical heads. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small leaflets, and the plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree. Ptiloria myrioclada is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
